resources.string: A highly customizable DNS and Firewall
Detect and block network security threats
Rethink uses accessibility service to detect and firewall background applications. Rethink does not collect or sell any information.
Rethink is the easiest way to monitor network activity, bypass Internet censorship, and firewall apps on your Android device.
Rethink is an open source software backed by Mozilla Builders MVP program.

string.name: warning_title
string.description: Status indicator text shown in a warning notification.

string.name: notification_content
string.description: Indicates what will happen if the user taps the notification.

resources.string: Protected! Connected to Fast and Secure DNS.
Paused! Blocked apps will continue to be firewalled.

string.name: status_waiting
string.description: This text appears during the connection process if Intra needs user permission or the phone is offline.

string.name: status_failing
string.description: This text appears if the connection is currently not working correctly. [CHAR_LIMIT=NONE]

string.name: status_protected
string.description: This is a large message in a reassuring color. It indicates that DNS queries can't be surveilled or modified in transit.

resources.string: protected with http proxy & private dns

string.name: status_strict
string.description: This is similar to dns_on, but the protection is being provided by the operating system, not by Rethink. It is not color-highlighted.

string.name: status_exposed
string.description: This is a large message in a scary color. It indicates that DNS queries can be surveilled or modified in transit.

string.name: dns_explanation_connected
string.description: The message will be shown when the DNS is connected

resources.string: Apply firewall rules on all applications based on device events, for example, firewall when the device is locked or when a particular app is not in use.
Monitor network activity and firewall any app or IP address.
Monitor, block, and encrypt DNS requests.
All of the above + bypass Internet censorship.
Rethink uses accessibility service to track which apps are in-use (foreground) versus those that are not in-use (background).\n\nRethink does not collect any information or spy on you in any way.

Rethink accessibility service has stopped or crashed. Goto Settings and Force Stop Rethink and start it again to use Block any app not in use feature.\n\nRethink uses accessibility service to track which apps are in-use (foreground) versus those that are not in-use (background).
Failure opening Accessibility Settings. Try again later!
This only deletes network logs but not firewall rules. This operation is not reversible. Do you want to proceed?
This deletes on-device DNS logs. This operation is not reversible. Do you want to proceed?

<u>#1</u>: Blocks an app from connecting to the Internet. 
 <u>#2</u>: Blocks any app from connecting to a particular IP. 
 <u>#3</u>: Blocks all connections when device locked (Universal Firewall). 
 <u>#4</u>: Blocks any app not in use (Universal Firewall). 
 <u>#5</u>: Blocks connections when source app unknown (Universal Firewall). 
 <u>#6</u>: Blocks all UDP traffic except DNS (Universal Firewall). 
 <u>#7</u>: Block connections when DNS is bypassed (Universal Firewall).
\"Always-On VPN\" is enabled on this device. To start Rethink, please go to Settings app and disable \"Always-on VPN\".
Always-on VPN is enabled for Rethink. Are you sure you want to stop Rethink anyway?
Rethink is running VPN in Lockdown mode. Stopping it would result in loss of Internet connectivity on this user profile. Do you want to continue anyway?
Rethink\'s DNS settings are overridden by Android\'s Private DNS.\n\nTo use Rethink\'s DNS go to Android Settings and turn off \"Private DNS\".
Deleting this rule would allow any app to connect to this IP. Do you want to proceed?
Delete the DNS over Https endpoint from saved configuration.
Delete the DNSCrypt resolver from saved configuration.
Delete the DNSCrypt relay from saved configuration.
Delete the DNS Proxy from saved configuration.
Download blocklists (around 60MB) to use this feature?
On-device blocklists are already at the latest version v%1$s.
Something went wrong. Try again later!
Blocklists are already at latest version.
Connection logging has been disabled. To re-enable, goto Settings and turn on Enable on-device logging.
DNS request logging has been disabled. To re-enable, goto Settings and turn on Enable on-device logging.

HTTP(S) Proxy settings are only a hint to applications but they may or may not use it; however, browsers like Chrome and Firefox do use these. Apps using HTTP(S) proxy will bypass both Firewall and DNS rules.
A new version of the app is available for download from the website. Do you want to proceed?
You are already on the latest version.
Either our servers are down or connection could not be established. Please try again after sometime.
The update cannot be executed right now, please try again later.
The trust domain rule works with Rethink\'s DNS only.
Store DNS and Firewall logs locally on-device.

LAN party!

1. New feature: Exclude Private IPs (LAN / link-local).
2. Make "Bypass DNS & Firewall" setting work.
3. Show "Maybe Blocked" in DNS Logs for domains that may be blocked by the Firewall.
4. Show adaptive icon where supported.
5. Bio-metric authentication prompts once every 15 minutes.
6. 6 other UI and performance improvements.

Help translate this app
Translate outbound IPv6 traffic to IPv4 on-device. Enable if you are connected to an IPv4-only network.
Exclude LAN, loopback, link-local routes from Rethink\'s VPN tunnel.

Allow requesting apps to access all available networks. These apps may bypass Rethink\'s VPN tunnel on-demand. Some audio/video conference apps like Zoom and Meet may require this to function properly.
Certain options disabled when VPN is in lockdown mode. See VPN settings.
Cannot setup proxies when VPN is running in DNS only mode or lockdown mode. Go to VPN settings
This setting is only a recommendation and it is possible that apps will ignore it. Apps using HTTP(S) proxy will bypass both Firewall and DNS rules.
Forwards all TCP connections to Orbot.
Recommends that apps use Orbot\'s HTTP proxy.
HTTP Proxy is set (apps may ignore it).
Forwarding %1$s to Orbot, HTTP Proxy also set.
Could not launch Orbot. Is it installed?
Rethink has stopped forwarding connections to Orbot, but Orbot maybe running in the background.
Rethink is setup to forward DNS queries to Orbot. Change as required.

Orbot is a free proxy app that empowers other apps to use the Internet more securely. \nOrbot uses Tor to encrypt your Internet traffic which helps you bypass censorship and defend against forms of network surveillance that threaten personal freedom and privacy. \nTCP Proxy: Rethink forwards only TCP connections of all but excluded apps to Orbot. \nHTTP Proxy: Rethink sets HTTP proxy but does not enforce that the apps use it. Usually, browsers like Chrome and Firefox do use it. Apps using HTTP(S) proxy will bypass both Firewall and DNS rules.
Orbot brings the features and functionality of Tor to Android.
Something went wrong, try after sometime
Orbot in non-vpn mode with HTTPS/SOCKS5.
Connected to Orbot. Turn it off to continue.
Turn off HTTP(S) and/or SOCKS5 proxy to continue with Tor-as-a-proxy setup.
Connected to Orbot. Turn it off to continue.
Failure starting Tor-as-a-Proxy. Open the Orbot app to start it manually.
On device power-up, start Rethink if it was running before shut down.
When enabled, Rethink uses all available networks to connect to Internet. If not, it uses whichever network is deemed active by Android.
When enabled, app firewall rules for metered (ex: Mobile) and non-metered (ex: WiFi) will not be honoured. \n\nDo you want to continue?
Automatically check for app updates once a week.
If disabled, Android\'s built-in Download Manager is used
Manually back up or restore app data and settings.
Enable notification permission for the app
The selected app will be excluded from the VPN to let it proxy connections on your behalf.
Auto (experimental)\nconnectivity checks are sent to ascertain reachability.
Action buttons to show with the Rethink notification: %1$s
\nPause / Stop (default):\nShows two buttons, to quickly pause and stop Rethink.
\nDNS / DNS + Firewall:\nShows two buttons to quickly switch between the battery-saver DNS mode and the regular DNS + Firewall mode.
Secure this app using your screen lock
Switch to DNS/DNS+Firewall mode to enable this setting
In rare cases when user-preferred DNS could not be ascertained, fallback DNS is used.
Error creating pcap file, Try again!
Use biometric authentication to unlock Rethink
Biometric authentication is not supported or disabled on this device

Rethink needs permission to set up a local VPN to encrypt the device\'s DNS requests, implement a network monitor, and enforce firewall rules. \n\nRethink does not collect any information or spy on you in any way.
Either VPN permission missing, or another app is in Always-on VPN mode.
Enable notification permission from Settings screen
You are one step away from safe and secure Android: Instantly see network activity, block websites, IPs, and badly behaving apps.
Exclude not possible in VPN lockdown mode
Cannot pause: Rethink in lockdown mode
Choose from 195+ blocklists. Click here to download or configure blocklists.
Show website icon in DNS logs (experimental)
Fetches website icons from nextdns.io and duckduckgo.com. Consumes up to 350 mb in disk space
When enabled, Rethink captures all packets on port 53 and forwards it to a user-set DNS endpoint
Check for blocklist updates once every three days
Rethink is the easiest way to monitor app activity, circumvent Internet censorship, and firewall apps on your Android device.
Rethink is a free and open-source project, led by ex-engineers from Amazon, IBM, and Scientific Games.
Could not fetch crash logs. Do you want to manually report your bug?
Rethink is part of Mozilla Builders MVP program.
Could not launch private dns screen.
Could not launch App Notification screen.

The Rethink Open Source Project owes its existence to these volunteers who devote countless hours on its development.

Assign unique IP per DNS request
Rules applied for %1$s will also be applicable for %2$s other apps
Block all apps when device is locked
Block any app not in use
Block when source app is unknown
Block UDP except DNS and NTP
Block newly installed apps by default
Block all except bypassed apps and IPs
Modify blocked or trusted Domain, IP / Port rules.
Deleting these rules would allow any application to connect to the currently blocked IPs.
Block apps from connecting to the Internet. Limiting access to the Internet helps prevent unwarranted data usage, as well as conserve battery.
Block connections on unmetered (WiFi) network for listed apps?
Allow connections on unmetered (WiFi) network for listed apps?
Block connections on metered (mobile) network for listed apps?
Allow connections on metered (mobile) network for listed apps?
Bypass Universal firewall rules for listed apps?
Bypass universal DNS & firewall rules for listed apps?
Exclude listed apps from DNS and Firewall?
Vpn is in lockdown mode. Firewall will not honour Metered / Unmetered rules.
Use all networks is enabled. Firewall will not honour Metered / Unmetered rules.
Error connecting to DNS Proxy server.
Excluding %1$s for %2$s in lockdown mode can cause Internet connectivity issues.
Cannot determine the current DNS server
Rethink accessibility service has stopped or crashed. No longer blocking backgrounded apps. Tap to re-enable.
Rethink accessibility service has stopped or crashed. No longer blocking backgrounded apps.
Note: %1$s blocked apps will continue to be firewalled.
Cannot change modes when VPN is lockdown. Tap to edit VPN settings.
No firewall rules matched this connection.

A user-set firewall rule blocked this app.

To change go to All Apps tab.

This app made connection for the first time.

To change go to Universal tab.

A user-set firewall rule blocked this app when trying to connect on Unmetered network.

To change go to All Apps tab.

A user-set firewall rule blocked this app when trying to connect on Metered network.

To change go to All Apps tab.

A user-set universal firewall rule blocked this app when trying to connect on Metered (Mobile) network.

To change go to Universal tab.

A user-set firewall rule blocked this app connecting to other than bypassed IPs.

To change go to All Apps tab.

This connection was allowed because the source app is set to bypass dns and firewall rules.

To change go to App-specific Firewall screen.

A user-set firewall rule blocked the destination IP / Port.

To change go to Universal tab.

A user-set firewall rule blocked the destination IP.

To change go to App-specific Firewall screen.

This connection was allowed because the destination IP is set as Trusted IP.

To change go to App-specific Firewall screen.

This connection was allowed because the destination IP is set to bypass all universal firewall rules.

To change go to IP Rules in Universal tab.

This connection was firewalled because device was locked at the time.

To change this behaviour go to Universal tab.

This connection was firewalled because the source app was not in the foreground.

To change this behaviour go to Universal tab.

This connection was firewalled because the source app could not be determined.

To change this behaviour go to Universal tab.

A user-set firewall rule blocked this UDP connection.

To change go to Universal tab.

This connection was blocked because the source app bypassed user-preferred DNS.

To change this behaviour go to Universal tab.

This connection was allowed because the source app is set to bypass universal firewall rules.

To change go to App-specific Firewall screen.

This DNS connection was proxied and forwarded to user-preferred DNS endpoint.

To change disable Prevent DNS leaks from DNS Configure screen.
This connection was allowed because one-click Tor-as-a-proxy setup via Orbot was in progress.

This connection was blocked because it likely used insecure HTTP.

To change go to Universal tab.

This connection was blocked because universal lockdown is set.

To change go to Universal tab.

A user-set firewall rule blocked the domain.

To change go to App-specific Firewall screen.

This connection was allowed because the domain is set as Trusted domain.

To change go to App-specific Firewall screen.

This connection was blocked because the domain is blocked by user-preferred DNS.

To change this behaviour go to Configure DNS tab.

This connection was blocked because the domain is set as blocked in Universal domain rules.

To change this behaviour go to Configure DNS tab.

This connection was allowed because the domain is set as trusted in Universal domain rules.

To change this behaviour go to Configure DNS tab.
Rethink blocked %1$s new apps. Tap to view or modify.
Network connection allowed for the app
Network connection denied for the app
Application in pause state, resume to continue
Inform when Rethink is active and running in the background
Inform when Rethink is stopped by Android or by another VPN app
Alert on Firewall errors and anomalies
Alert on Proxy errors and anomalies
Alert on Download Progress for On-device blocklists
Delete the domain from saved configuration.
Custom URL(domain) or wild card to either allow or block. eg, *.test.com, test.com/test
Allow (bypass) or block IP address, IP subnet (range), Port. Example: 10.10.10.10, 10.1.1.*, 10.2.2/24, ffff::/104, [::]:80, [10.1.0.0/16]:80, *.*:80
Invalid IP address, subnet or port.

No network logs for this app.

resources.string: Clear all logs related to this application.

Do you want to apply newly configured blocklists?
Download blocklists (around 60MB) to use this feature.
Showing <u>%1$s</u> blocklists in group: %2$s and subgroup: %3$s
280+ locations; higher uptime; stub resolver running on cloudflare.com
50+ locations; more private; recursive resolver running on fly.io
Coalesce requests, cache responses, resilient error handling
Backup app settings, network, and dns logs
Doesn\'t work across app versions or devices
Backs up app settings, network, and dns logs to a file. This will restart the VPN.
Restore app settings, network, and dns logs from a backup file. This will restart the app.

string.name: rsv_blocklist_count_text
string.description: This label will appear in rethink configure simple view screen which shows number of blocklists for each category

string.name: ssv_app_blocked_heading
string.description: This label will appear on the stats screen as a header for blocked applications.
